trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (JavaScript) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (JavaScript) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Store JavaScript app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Store JavaScript app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to the app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to the app]

trans-unit.source: [Store authentication tokens on the client]
trans-unit.target: [Store authentication tokens on the client]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the authentication flow managed by Mobile Services using a variety of identity providers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the authentication flow managed by Mobile Services using a variety of identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.
trans-unit.target: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.

trans-unit.source: To instead use Live Connect with client-managed authentication and provide a single sign-on experience in your Windows Phone app, see the topic [Single sign-on for Windows Store apps by using Live Connect].
trans-unit.target: To instead use Live Connect with client-managed authentication and provide a single sign-on experience in your Windows Phone app, see the topic [Single sign-on for Windows Store apps by using Live Connect].

trans-unit.source: By using client-managed authentication, your app has access to additional user data maintained by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: By using client-managed authentication, your app has access to additional user data maintained by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: You can get the same user data in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can get the same user data in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>this post</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>this post</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Complete the steps in
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Complete the steps in

trans-unit.source: Register your Windows Store app package for Microsoft authentication
trans-unit.target: Register your Windows Store app package for Microsoft authentication

trans-unit.source: Note that this step is optional because it only applies to the Microsoft Account login provider. When you register your Windows Store app package information with Mobile Services, the client is able to re-use Microsoft Account login credentials for a single sign-on experience. If you do not do this, your Microsoft Account login users will be presented with a login prompt every time that the login method is called. Complete this step when you plan to use the Microsoft Account identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Note that this step is optional because it only applies to the Microsoft Account login provider. When you register your Windows Store app package information with Mobile Services, the client is able to re-use Microsoft Account login credentials for a single sign-on experience. If you do not do this, your Microsoft Account login users will be presented with a login prompt every time that the login method is called. Complete this step when you plan to use the Microsoft Account identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with your chosen authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with your chosen authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run this quickstart-based app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run this quickstart-based app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the

trans-unit.target: TodoItem

trans-unit.source: table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, <link><linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users[authorize users with scripts]</linkText><title></title></link>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, <link><linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users[authorize users with scripts]</linkText><title></title></link>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
